text.53_Chapter, 10_Verse, 0_Comment: This was said about Jerusalem, that she is like a poor afflicted one shivering as if from a storm wind and there is no one to console her
text.58_Chapter, 20_Verse, 0_Comment: "And for me, this is my covenant:" He means to say, "Upon this I will make a covenant with them, 'says the Lord.'" And [then] he explained what he made the covenant upon and said, "The spirit of prophecy that rests upon you - you, Israel - and the words of Torah that I placed in your mouth to teach them, behold these two 'will not depart from your mouth, etc. says the Lord,' such that they will not depart 'from now and forever' until the end of all the generations."
text.39_Chapter, 0_Verse, 0_Comment: Comfort, Comfort. Your G-d says to the prophets "Comfort my people", and the doubling of the word alludes to the stress of the command.
text.10_Chapter, 0_Verse, 0_Comment: 1. Dont be surprised by the great Nissim Hashem is doing becuase a time will come that Hashem will do greater nissim. talking about the time of moshiach
text.1_Chapter, 2_Verse, 4_Comment: For out of Zion â€“ Because the true Torah is that which comes out of Zion. There is no other in the world.
text.27_Chapter, 9_Verse, 0_Comment: For there is a commandment for a commandment: Because of the pleasure and due to the abundance of material possessions they are so far from the commandments of God that it has become necessary to add commandments to the commandments of God. This is to say, to make more and more 'fences' and 'walls' for the commandments of God. And then more 'fences' and 'walls' must be made for the first 'fences' and 'walls' and another commandment.
text.27_Chapter, 9_Verse, 2_Comment: Line for a line. Based on the plumb lines that are used to keep a building straight; that is why a 'fence' (literally, a watch guard) is called a plumb line. This is to say that it is now required to make another watch guard for the previous watch guard.
